title: What are the best SSD manufacturers? - Quora

response.answer_text: The biggest one is Samsung, and they have a pretty solid reputation for reliability which from my experience is pretty well deserved. However, they also are definitely the ‘premium’ brand- usually quite a bit more expensive than competitors. There’s a lot of runners up, and I’ve used SSDs made by a bunch of them (Intel, Adata, Crucial, Toshiba, Lite-On, HP, Western Digital etc.) Honestly, I haven’t had an issue with any of them. If it’s a known brand, it’s probably going to be fine unless you get a lemon, which does happen from time to time. So, just be sure to actually try using the drive sometime before your return window runs out.

Over the years I have used the Samsung Pro, Crucial MX500, Kingston HyperX, and OCZ SSD’s. I can’t remember the model of the OCZ, maybe Octane, but it did have a SandForce controller… anyway, it’s the only SSD I’ve ever owned that just flat out died! LOL! These days I only use Samsung Pro’s for my own builds, but if I’m recommending drives to friends for builds or upgrades I always recommend the Crucial if they don’t have the budget for the Samsung. Both manufacturers produce a top quality product and back it up with generous warranties.
